trans-unit.source: "We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."\n—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

trans-unit.source: "I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone."\n—A wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca
